mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The Riverside Improvement Company, headed by Emery E. Childs, commissioned well-known landscape architect Frederick Law Olmsted and his partner, Calvert Vaux to design a "rural" community in 1868. William Le Baron Jenney designed many iconic features of Riverside, including the Water Tower, and the homes of several prominent townspeople including the Hollisters. http://www.burnhamweb.com/burnhamweb/programs/riverside/riverside.html [work]
